newsitem.title: UK: LPC - Hungarian bank seeks loan bids.
newsitem.headline: LPC - Hungarian bank seeks loan bids.

text.p: LONDON, October 8 (LPC) - The Hungarian Bank for Investment and Development has invited banks to bid to arrange a $60 million syndicated loan for general corporate financing, according to Janos Albert, director of the Budapest-based bank.
Bids are expected to be in hand at the borrower within several days, according to Albert.
The bank plans to use the credit to fund further lending.

In August, the Hungarian Bank for Investment and Development signed a $75 million term loan at 80 bps with a 3.5-year maturity. That loan was arranged by ABN AMRO Bank, Bayerische Vereinsbank and Central-European Investment Bank and was increased from $50 million after an oversubscription.
